document.masterDocTitle: Variable Selection and Inference for Multi-period Forecasting Problems

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Variable Selection and Inference for Multi-period Forecasting Problems

subSubSection.paragraph:
The description of
H. pearstonensis
was published in part 4 of volume 15 of the Transactions of the South African Philosophical Society that was issued on 26 January 1905 (printed on cover of this issue). Thus, it has priority over
H. schönlandi
that was published in issue 5 of volume 1 of the Records of the Albany Museum issued on 26 September 1905 .

Diagnosis. The male is characterised by the bifid lower gonostylus, which forms a small, slender projection and a broad, hyaline, hairy projection. The female of
P. pearstonensis
is similar to that of
P. chubbi
. They can be easily distinguished by the size of the head, which is (slightly) longer than wide in
P. chubbi
and about as long as wide in
P. pearstonensis
. The female of
P. cinctifera
differs from
P. pearstonensis
in having the basal area of the propodeum finely wrinkled. This area is coarsely wrinkled in
P. pearstonensis
.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 78.
Patellapis
( Ch .) pearstonensis
, female: a. Head (scale=0,5mm); b. Scutum (scale=0,5mm); c. Scutellum and propodeum (scale=0,5mm); d. Metasomal terga (scale=1mm); e. Body (scale=1mm); f. Inner hind tibial spur (scale=100µm); g. Basitibial plate (scale=100µm).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Male . Bl = 5,6–5,8mm . General habitus ( Fig. 79e ). Head . L = 1,5–1,6mm ; W = 1,6–1,7mm . Head about as long as wide. Integument black except mandibles and lower area of clypeus sometimes partly reddishbrown (in some specimens yellowish). Clypeus, supraclypeal area, paraocular area and vertex covered with erect, whitish to greyish hairs. Mandibles simple. Antennae mostly brownish. Flagellomeres of normal structure (not knotty). A4 about as long as A3 (A4 at most 1,5 times longer than A3). Mesosoma . L = 1,0– 1,1mm ; W (ITS) = 1,1–1,2mm . Integument black. Scutum polished; sparsely punctate (i = 2,0–2,5d) ( Fig. 79a ). Scutellum as illustrated in Fig. 79b . Scutum, scutellum, metanotum, mesepisternum and propodeum with, whitish to greyish, erect hairs. Basal area of propodeum as illustrated in Fig. 79b ; propodeum and marginal region of posterior truncation slightly dull; chagreened and reticulate; propodeum with small punctures. Wings . Hyaline. Legs . Integument mostly brownish. Vestiture greyish. Metasoma . L = 3,0– 3,4mm ; W = 1,5–1,6mm . Integument reddish except the margins of T usually pallid reddish; T1 usually blackish anteriorly; T4–T6 often extensively brownish to blackish (some specimens with completely brownish-black metasomal terga); margins of T extensively translucent ( Fig. 79c ). Apical plate broad; rounded apically. Posterior margin of S4with a sparse row of 6 long, curled, erect bristles; bristles greatly enlarged laterally. Metasomal sterna S5–S6 without dense hair patches ( Fig. 79d ). S7 and S8 as illustrated in
Fig. 79f
. Genitalia . Genitalia as illustrated in
Fig. 79g –h
; gonocoxa extensively dull; gonostylus with dorsolateral, slender projection; projection hairless; lower gonostylus is divided into a small, slender projection and a broad, hyaline, hairy projection.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 79.
Patellapis
( Ch .) pearstonensis
, male: a. Scutum (scale=0,5mm); b. Scutellum and propodeum (scale=0,5mm); c. Metasomal terga (scale=1mm); d. Metasomal sterna (scale=1mm); e. Body (scale=1mm); f. Metasomal sterna S7 and S8, ventral view (scale=100µm); g. Genitalia, dorsal view (scale=100µm); h. Genitalia, lateral view (scale=100µm).

Distribution ( Fig. 80 ). Widespread from the eastern parts of South Africa to the southwest of Namibia .

( Asteraceae ),

,

,

,

,
